name: Normal third country tariff duty (including ceilings)
description: This code stands for all cases where no preference but the normal third country rate is applied.

name: Tariff suspension
description: Temporary suspensions from the autonomous customs duties are granted for certain goods of the agricultural, chemical, aeronautical and microelectronic sector. Others are shown as footnotes to certain Combined Nomenclature (CN) codes.

name: Tariff suspension subject to a specific end-use
description: Certain suspensions are linked to a specific destination, a so-called end-use pursuant to Article 82 of the Common Customs Code. Commodities are identified by the symbol 'S' in the UK Trade Tariff and the footnote 'subject to end-use'.

name: Tariff suspension subject to the production of a special certificate
description: No case has been found at present, such a possibility could however be created for example for goods to be denatured before being imported under a suspension.

name: Tariff suspension subject to Airworthiness Certificates
description: Suspension of duty (not including VAT) for importations of civil aircraft parts which must be accompanied by an airworthiness certificate. An AI Statement - 10100 must be entered in Box 44 and endorsed ‘Import with Airworthiness Certificate’.

name: Tariff quota, notably GATT quota
description: GATT quotas are shown as footnotes to the CN. Examples can be found in Chapter 3 and for codes 0802, 0805 and 0806.

name: Tariff quota, notably GATT quota, subject to a specific end- use
description: Examples of GATT quotas under the condition of an end-use can be found in footnotes to codes 0102 90 (a quota with a serial number) and 0302 31 to 39 (a global quota without a serial number).

name: Tariff quota, notably GATT quota, subject to the production of a special certificate
description: GATT quotas exist for handicraft products and those produced on handlooms. The preferential quota is only applied on the production of the relevant certificate, which must be entered in Box 44 against the relevant document code as shown in UK Trade Tariff: document, certificate and authorisation codes for harmonised declarations. Other cases could be created, for example for goods to be denatured before being admitted to a quota.

name: Tariff quota following outward processing
description: No case has been found where the re-importation of textiles in the framework of an economic outward processing quota is admitted. Such a possibility could however be created.

name: Exemption for end-use resulting from the CCT
description:
All cases of end-use are marked by one of the following footnotes to the relevant CN code:
- 'Entry under this subheading is subject to conditions laid down in the relevant EU provisions'
- 'Entry under this subheading is subject to conditions laid down in relief on goods used for a prescribed use'
- 'Subject to end-use control - see UK Trade Tariff: relief on goods used for a prescribed use'

name: Admission to certain CN subheadings subject to a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods
description: The relevant certificates are mentioned in Annex 9 of Council Regulation 2658/87/EEC.

name: GSP rate without conditions or limits (including ceilings)
description: Application of the GSP duty rate without conditions or limits (form A)

name: Tariff suspension under GSP
description: It is unlikely that a temporary suspension of the autonomous tariff duties for GSP only will be created.

name: Tariff suspension subject to specific end-use under GSP
description: It is unlikely that a temporary suspension of the autonomous tariff duties for GSP only and subject to a specific end-use will be created.

name: Tariff suspension subject to a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods
description: It is unlikely that a tariff suspension for GSP only and subject to a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods will be created.

name: Tariff quota
description: The GSP rate is only applicable within the limits of a tariff quota. In these cases, the serial number for the quota is shown beside the preferential rate in the printed version of the TARIC.

name: Tariff quota subject to a specific end-use
description: The application of the quota may be granted under the condition of an end-use only.

name: Tariff quota subject to a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods
description: In this case, the use of a tariff quota under GSP would depend on the issue of a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods.

name: Tariff quota following outward processing
description: No case exists, for the time being, where the re-importation of textiles in the framework of an economic outward processing quota is admitted under GSP.

name: Exemption for end-use resulting from the CCT
description: No case has been found where the exemption for end-use resulting from the CCT is restricted to GSP. Such a possibility could however be created.

name: Application of GSP rates subject to a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods
description: Currently, this case is not applicable.

name: Tariff preference without conditions or limits (including ceilings)
description: Application of the relevant preferential rate without conditions or limits (Certificates EUR1, EUR-MED, or equivalent proofs of preferential origin).

name: Tariff suspension under preferential agreements
description: A temporary suspension of the autonomous duty rates under preferential agreements.

name: Tariff suspension subject to a specific end-use under preferential agreements
description: It is unlikely that a temporary suspension of the autonomous duty rates subject to a specific end-use under a preferential agreement will be created.

name: Tariff suspension subject to a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods
description: No case has been found, however, such a possibility could be created.

name: Tariff quota
description: The preferential rate is only applicable within the limits of a quota. In these cases the serial number of the quota is mentioned beside the preferential duty rate in the printed version of the TARIC.

name: Tariff quota subject to a specific end-use
description: The application of the quota is granted only where a specific end- use is prescribed for the imported goods.

name: Tariff quota subject to a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods
description: Claim to other tariff preferences within the limits of a preference quota subject to a certificate being presented confirming the special nature of the product for example Volume 2 Additional Information Section states that a Certificate of Designation of Origin and a EUR1 is required for claims to a preferential quota for Western Balkan wine.

name: Tariff quota following outward processing
description: This code applies to re-importation of textiles after economic outward processing within the framework of preferential agreements.

name: Exemption for end-use resulting from the CCT
description: It is unlikely that exemption for end-use resulting from the CCT will be restricted to certain preferential agreements.

name: Application of preferential duty rates subject to a certificate confirming the special nature of the goods
description: The relevant certificates are mentioned in Articles 16 to 34 of the implementing provisions of the UCC customs code.

name: Non imposition of customs duties under the provisions of Customs Union Agreements concluded by the EU with Turkey
description: For certain products in headings 1704, 1803, 1804, 1805, 1806, 1901, 190211, 190219, 1903, 1904, 1905, 2101, 2102, 2103, 2104, 2105, 210610, 210620, 2202, 2205 and for all products in Chapters 25-97 (with the exception of Coal and Steel (see the list in Notice 812) and products in Tariff headings 3502, 4501 5301 and 5302) which are covered by forms ATR (see code 420 below for those agricultural products which are exceptionally covered by forms ATR for the purposes of annual tariff quotas); Andorra for all products in Chapters 25-97 ), and for San Marino for all products (with the exception of coal and steel) in Chapters 1- 97 of the UK Trade Tariff.

name: Tariff Quota
description: Non imposition of duty within the limits of annual tariff quotas for certain products in headings 1704, 1806, 1901, 1902, 1904, 1905 and 2106 which are imported from Turkey under cover of forms ATR.
